title: Spearhead from Space
goofs: The Doctor clutches his head before being shot at the start of episode two.
The Doctor is gurning as he's attacked by tentacles.
The Nestenes don't kill the General once duplicated, instead leaving him comatose in a wax museum.

continuity_notes.name: The Doctor
continuity_notes.description: Time Lord with two hearts, inhuman blood type and cardiovascular system. Can communicate with eyebrows in the language of Delphon and put himself into a coma.

continuity_notes.name: TARDIS
continuity_notes.description: The Doctor's time and space machine
continuity_notes.current_status: Dematerialization codes changed by Time Lords

continuity_notes.name: Liz Shaw
continuity_notes.description: Expert on meteorites with degrees in medicine, physics, and other subjects
continuity_notes.current_status: Seconded to UNIT from Cambridge University

continuity_notes.name: UNIT
continuity_notes.description: United Nations Intelligence Taskforce, dealing with extraterrestrial threats
continuity_notes.current_status: Active, with London HQ and various capabilities

continuity_notes.name: Nestenes
continuity_notes.description: Alien collective intelligence colonizing worlds for 1000 million years

continuity_notes.name: Autons
continuity_notes.description: Plastic servants of the Nestenes, capable of various abilities including energy projection
continuity_notes.current_status: Active on Earth as invasion force

technobabble: Nestene energy units are manufactured spheres made of non-thermoplastic, non-thermosetting plastic with no polymer chains, estimated at 3000cc capacity.
roots: The Day the Earth Stood Still
The Avengers' 'The Cybernauts' and 'Never, Never Say Die'
Adam Adamant Lives!' 'A Vintage Year for Scoundrels'

locations.name: London
locations.description: Capital city of the United Kingdom
locations.current_status: Site of UNIT HQ and invasion activity

locations.name: Ashbridge
locations.description: Town in the Epping area of Essex

untold_adventures: Two attempted invasions of Earth since UNIT was formed, both involving the Doctor
additional_notes: The Doctor discards his trilby in this story. He has a cobra/dragon tattoo on his right forearm, possibly a Time Lord criminal brand.
bottom_line: Gloriously well directed on film, with a gorgeous tracking shot in episode one.
